intro: Jacea pseudophrygia, commonly known as the false pomegranate, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, palmate leaves, and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruit is a small, round capsule that splits open to release seeds. Jacea pseudophrygia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
